TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SplitterEventArgs extends System.EventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides data for and the events.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Splitter.SplitterMoving> event occurs when the user is moving the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Splitter> control. The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Splitter.SplitterMoved> event occurs when the user finishes moving the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Splitter> control. The SplitterEventArgs class specifies the position of the mouse pointer and the position of the upper-left corner of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Splitter> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this type. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SplitContainer.SplitterMoved> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SplitContainer> named `SplitContainer1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SplitContainer.SplitterMoved> event.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#548](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.s_19_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#548](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.s_19_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: public SplitterEventArgs (int x, int y, int splitX, int splitY);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(int32 x, int32 y, int32 splitX, int32 splitY) cil managed

Docs.param: The x-coordinate of the mouse pointer (in client coordinates).
The y-coordinate of the mouse pointer (in client coordinates).
The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the (in client coordinates).
The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the (in client coordinates).
Docs.summary: Initializes an instance of the class with the specified coordinates of the mouse pointer and the coordinates of the upper-left corner of the control.
Gets or sets the x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the (in client coordinates).
Docs.value: The x-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use this property along with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SplitterEventArgs.SplitY%2A> property of this class to determine the position of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Splitter> control when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Splitter.SplitterMoving> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Splitter.SplitterMoved> events are raised.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates the use of this member. In the example, an event handler reports on the occurrence of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SplitContainer.SplitterMoved?displayProperty=fullName> event. This report helps you to learn when the event occurs and can assist you in debugging. To report on multiple events or on events that occur frequently, consider replacing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.MessageBox.Show%2A?displayProperty=fullName> with <xref:System.Console.WriteLine%2A?displayProperty=fullName> or appending the message to a multiline <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox>.
To run the example code, paste it into a project that contains an instance of type <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SplitContainer> named `SplitContainer1`. Then ensure that the event handler is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.SplitContainer.SplitterMoved?displayProperty=fullName> event.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#548](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.s_142_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.EventExamples#548](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.s_142_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the (in client coordinates).
Docs.value: The y-coordinate of the upper-left corner of the control.
